means: 弄脏，弄湿，弄皱( bedraggle的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_cn: 他看上去又疲惫，又邋遢。

sentence.Network_en: It was the grim resolution of a bent, bedraggled, but unbroken pride.
sentence.Network_cn: 这是一颗被压弯 、 玷污, 但还没有被压碎的自尊心坚强地下的决心.

sentence.Network_en: The women lost no time in starting back, bedraggled as drowned rats.
sentence.Network_cn: 几个青年妇女划着她们的小船赶紧回家, 一个个像落水鸡似的.

list.abs: a shy smile and a retiring manner , Liu Deshun has the slightly bedraggled appearance of an ageing professor .腼腆的微笑，拘谨的举止，老教授那种略显邋遢的外表，这就是刘德顺。
in such a condition/state 处于一种状态bedraggled condition 拖泥带水的状态such...that.. 如此...以至于.
the beggar's bedraggled clothes .这个句子不合语法.
a street of bedraggled tenements ; a broken-down fence ; a ramshackle old pier ; a tumble-down shack .满街破旧的房屋；破旧的篱笆；摇摇欲坠的老码头；摇摇欲坠的小木屋。

entry.tran: 湿漉漉的；乱蓬蓬的；脏兮兮的
entry.def: Someone or something that is bedraggled looks untidy because they have got wet or dirty.

example.tran: 他看上去又疲惫，又邋遢。

means.word_mean: 1. limp and soiled as if dragged in the mud;

sentences.sentence: "scarecrows in battered hats or draggled skirts"

auth_sentence.content: We have all seen bedraggled people in the street carrying signs announcing the end is nigh.
auth_sentence.res_content: We have all seen bedraggled people in the street carrying signs announcing the end is nigh.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We have all seen bedraggled people in the street carrying signs announcing the end is nigh.

auth_sentence.content: When the men first show up in veterans' court, they come straight from jail, bedraggled and shackled, heads down.
auth_sentence.res_content: When the men first show up in veterans' court, they come straight from jail, bedraggled and shackled, heads down.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: When the men first show up in veterans' court, they come straight from jail, bedraggled and shackled, heads down.

auth_sentence.content: "The bedraggled enemy continues his cowardly advance," goes the headline, as the Germans take town after town.
auth_sentence.res_content: "The bedraggled enemy continues his cowardly advance," goes the headline, as the Germans take town after town.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "The bedraggled enemy continues his cowardly advance," goes the headline, as the Germans take town after town.
